title: Google\Cloud\Monitoring\V3\TextLocator
name: TextLocator
description:
A locator for text. Indicates a particular part of the text of a request or of an object referenced in the request.

For example, suppose the request field text contains: text: "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog." Then the locator: source: "text" start_position { line: 1 column: 17 } end_position { line: 1 column: 19 } refers to the part of the text: "fox".

Generated from protobuf message google.monitoring.v3.TextLocator

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.source
params.description: The source of the text. The source may be a field in the request, in which case its format is the format of the google.rpc.BadRequest.FieldViolation.field field in https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors#error_details. It may also be be a source other than the request field (e.g. a macro definition referenced in the text of the query), in which case this is the name of the source (e.g. the macro name).

params.name: data.start_position
params.description: The position of the first byte within the text.

params.name: data.end_position
params.description: The position of the last byte within the text.

params.name: data.nested_locator
params.description: If source, start_position, and end_position describe a call on some object (e.g. a macro in the time series query language text) and a location is to be designated in that object's text, nested_locator identifies the location within that object.

params.name: data.nesting_reason
params.description: When nested_locator is set, this field gives the reason for the nesting. Usually, the reason is a macro invocation. In that case, the macro name (including the leading '@') signals the location of the macro call in the text and a macro argument name (including the leading '$') signals the location of the macro argument inside the macro body that got substituted away.

methods.name: getNestedLocator
methods.description:
If source, start_position, and end_position describe a call on some object (e.g. a macro in the time series query language text) and a location is to be designated in that object's text, nested_locator identifies the location within that object.

Generated from protobuf field .google.monitoring.v3.TextLocator nested_locator = 4;

methods.name: setNestedLocator
methods.description:

Generated from protobuf field .google.monitoring.v3.TextLocator nested_locator = 4;

params.name: var
params.description: If source, start_position, and end_position describe a call on some object (e.g. a macro in the time series query language text) and a location is to be designated in that object's text, nested_locator identifies the location within that object.

methods.name: getNestingReason
methods.description:
When nested_locator is set, this field gives the reason for the nesting.

Usually, the reason is a macro invocation. In that case, the macro name (including the leading '@') signals the location of the macro call in the text and a macro argument name (including the leading '$') signals the location of the macro argument inside the macro body that got substituted away.

Generated from protobuf field string nesting_reason = 5;
